_comment: Created by NCODowd on 16/11/2016 17:22:45 using v2.7
title: How has the number of nurses, midwives and health visitors changed?
analysis_commentary:
There is annual variation in the number of nurses, midwives, and health visitors, with a trough roughly each August followed by a rise as newly qualified staff members join the workforce. A peak in numbers is then reached in the winter, followed by a decline as staff leave the workforce. There was a decrease in the average number of staff members between 2009 and 2012, but since then numbers have increased, reaching a high of 307k in November 2015 .

Updated November 2016
